Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: Solid_Snake_ka
Reviews.Content: Plus points are the close proximity to the Kallang MRT station. Nice, clean rooms with a 32' LCD TV. Low cost compared other hotels. Only down point is again the location where does look a bit 'unclean' particually in the evenings on the way to the hotel from the MRT

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Nagruti
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for only two nights, we picked it because of the location, close to shops and food. The building is old and our room was small, bathroom is ok for us. it is good for budget traveler or transit. The third night we move to the one at Bugis which is newer and better. We didn't have breakfast at any of these hotels. If you are on a tight budget, it is the most affordable accommodation in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel near Kallang MRT station”
Reviews.Author: museroom
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a very affordable rate and was a 10-minute walk from Kallang MRT station. Group desk transfer from Changi Airport was a reasonable Sgd 9/person. When my husband and I got there, the first room assigned to us was dirty, but the front desk promptly assigned us to another room when we raised it to his attention. The air on was noisy though, and we had to adjust the temperature a it to make it bearable quiet down. The surrounding neighborhood has a lot of Indians loitering and staying in the grassy area, though they do not bother you. Aside from the nearby MRT, there are also plenty of cabs that you can hail in case you prefer an alternative mode of transport. For what it's worth, the place is a no-frills budget hotel that's good and safe enough to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “My stay @ Fragrance Hotel-Emerald”
Reviews.Author: muek
Reviews.Content: I booked a room thru agoda.com which cost me around 1500 THB per night but this rate is exclusive of breakfast. Stayed there for 3 nights in April 2012,I found that this hotel is rather good for budget traveller. If you don't spend your whole day at the hotel just for your whink of sleep then this hotel is your good choice. Its location is on geylang Lor1 road where you can find a number of seafood, chinesere staurants and fruit stalls near by especially for those who like "durians" Geylang street must be their favourite zone. To get to the hotel is very convenience, from Changi airport just take a MRT to Tanah Merah Junction then transitted by the east west line train to kallang station. It will totally take you around 30 minutes to the Kallang MRT. After arrving at Kallang station, keep walking on the left of the Kallang MRT station to Geylang Lor 1 road cross the intersection to Sim Ave and keep walikng straing on Sim Ave till you find the gas station walk pass the gas station. The Gelay Lor 6 where the hotel located on is just 2 block away from the gas station. Very easy to find it. Even though Geylang area is regarded as a red light district, I feel very safe and confortable during stayed there. Regarding the room, it is a compact room size with good aircon function. The bed sheet is clean but the pillow is too soft for me. this isn't a big issue though. The toilet is also clean there isn't a bath tub but only shower. The hotel provides toothbrushes, 2 small cup of drinking water, tea coffer maker and 2 packs of instant coffee every day. Safey box not provied in room you must contact front desk if you want I think it would be cost applied but I haven't used it. If you want to use internet ( both WIFI and the hotels PC) just buy a coupon from the front desk as well.It costs around 2 Singapor dollars for 30 minutes. It would be very good if the hotel provide free WIFI I think 2 dollars is very dear for just 30 minutes. Besides, the front desk agents are nice and handful.I ahd booked a wrong date for my departure flight, a front desk lady staff helped me contact the airline and got me a free of flight ticket printed. Overall, if I go back to Singapore next time, this hotel would be one of my choice.

Reviews.Title: “promotional rates are nonrefundable booking...pls be warned!”
Reviews.Author: len521
Reviews.Content: i booked early to avoid wasting time looking for nice hotels, since emerald hotel got the positive reviews and one of the best 2star hotels in geylang...so i booked early on line through agoda...they didnt say anything about the non refundable booking until i called the fragrance hotel reservation office! the agoda website said free cancelllation and if you'll read the booking conditions they didnt say about the promotional rates are non refundable...so we must pay the WHOLE 2days even if we dont use it or even if i cancel in advance!!!! Please be warned for the first timers, since i dint read about anything that the promotional rates are non refundable in tripadvisory reviews! I feel i've been fooled!!! I dont know if its the fragrance hotel management's fault or the agoda's...either ways it's too late now since the mistake is done already!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A PINOY HAVEN---It's a Good Budget Hotel so Keep your Expectations Real”
Reviews.Author: budjski
Reviews.Content: My wife booked 2 De Luxe rooms for ourselves and our two sons.We were well aware of negative reviews about this hotel but the price was just too good to pass! Anyway,we reasoned out that most of the time we would be out visiting sights. It was easy to reach by taxi from Changi Airport and cost us only $ 15 SD. Unfortunately, our rooms (De Luxe) weren't ready yet until 3:00 PM, so the desk clerks suggested we put our luggage in a holding room and tour the city which we did. When my wife and I returned to check us in, we were pleasantly surprised by our rooms (Rm.509 & 510.) Both were small but were clean,and we had new towels and bedding. There was hot water and we even had complimentary coffee! Going to and from the hotel was not a problem as the Kallang MRT station was just a healthy walk away. At the Kallang station there were food outlets: Bread Talk,Old Chang Kee,Mr.Bean and a 7-11. Along Sims Avenue my wife and I discovered fruit stands where we had a snack of mangoes,papayas,and dragon fruit for $5SD. Breakfast was no problem because Chinese restos like the Mongkok Dimsum were nearby. Geylang Road is lined with lots of hawkers food restos so for our last dinner we had a filling meal of delicious Cereal Prawns,Chili Crab,Yang Chow rice and drinks for only $70 SD. Many Filipinos use the Fragrance Emerald hotel so it's easy to feel at home. A bonus is that we get to share tips on where to get a taxi easily or where to go. So if you're really on a budget, and you're not too finicky about hotel amenities, this hotel's for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy management”
Reviews.Author: weekender282day
Reviews.Content: Booked for a room using OctopusTravel but when was there, told me rooms were been serviced/maintained and had me transferred to their sister hotel. I should be given a choice to ask for a refund shouldn't I? Interestingly two tourists got their rooms. Yes, Fragance provided the taxi fare and helped called a cab but still i thought I had a steal when I got Emerald knowing it was recently renovated as compared to Pearl and if you see their rates online you would know that Emerald charges higher than Pearl. Can't help feeling ripped off. So be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellerporirua
Reviews.Content: While this Hotel is located in one of the notorious Red light area, Fragrance Emerald offers tidy rooms with clean linen and towels. The staff are friendly and approachable. The cleaning staff do a great job everyday, with good vacuuming, changing linen and supplying fresh amenities. For a little extra, you are able to get a room with a bath tub. Air con is very good. You also find a number of hawkers providing good food for reasonable price around this hotel. Buses and taxis are easy to access. For a budget hotel it is excellent at about S$ 63 to 67 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Buged hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albertusguntur
Reviews.Content: A pretty good hotel and clean for buged hotel in Singapore, a lot of food vendors stout at night and around 5 block from kalang MRT station

Reviews.Title: “Economical and clean”
Reviews.Author: Chiegel
Reviews.Content: From March 19-22 2012. For a budgeted hotel, the room was decent and clean all the time, The hotel is very close to the MRT which was a plus and close to restaurants. The room may not be big, but the size is fair. The washroom is clean and the hotel smells nice. Geylang may be the red district of Singapore but through out the whole stay in there and always coming back to the hotel at night, we didn't see any of them. The room was pretty basic but if you really wanted a place to crash and you have a tight budget... The place is decent and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “affordable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: marvifromdasma
Reviews.Content: From March 8 to 11, 2012, My family (4 of us), consisting of 2 children, 9 and 7 stayed in the family room, room 715 to be exact. There were 2 beds. 3 of us stayed in 1 bed, which was just fine, we slept well. My son wanted the single bed. We paid 257 Sing dollars for 4 nights, which is actually cheap compared to other hotels. there is a flat screen TV, but not really a source of entertainment as there were a few local channels. There was free coffee and water everyday. Towels were clean and white, free toothbrush, soap, hot and cold water. There is a bath tub. There was no ref and cabinet, which was just ok for us. The bed was not really soft, but not lumpy. They clean the room daily. They are also very honest, nothing was amiss. My kids like the room, and for me, it may not be the best, but i think we got a good deal. A few meters away, there are restaurants, convenience store. It is about 15 minutes walk from Kallang MRT. There are buses passing nearby. There is no free internet service though. please visit my full reviews in my blog www.infocomrade.com

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not sound proof, but love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: apple_wine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3D2N for a family vacation. My husband prefers this hotel in Geylang because of its strategic location very near in the restaurants and bus stops. The hotel lobby smells so nice too. I reserved 3 bedrooms (Family room, 2 double bed bedrooms) as early as January as this hotel is always fully booked. Water in room has strong pressure. No problem at all. Soaps, toothbrush, Shower cap are provided and a must for me, Hair dryer. Complimentary water, Coffee is also provided. Room is not that spacious but good enough for 2 persons. Cable TV channels are very limited. On our first night, I was awakened by a couple fighting in their room; they are very noisy and too loud. I just wish that the rooms in Fragrance hotel are all sound proof. Overall, we will keep coming back to this hotel and will recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: JerryOu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a family trip. The hotel was not far from bus stop. Actually, there are other bus stops in walking distance that can virtually take you to any tourist attractions. Check-in was fast. We arrived there early and 2 out of 3 rooms we've booked were ready for us. The room itself was so-so but has just been newly renovated. Bed was small, a 5 feet one. Sheet was clean but little too hard. Pillows were too soft, though. There was no fridge in the room. Cleanliness was ok. Location was great. So many food shops around the area and they almost open all night long. Since the hotel is in red light district, I can spot some brothels at the end of the street. However, I didn't encounter with those girls and it was quiet around the hotel. I recommend this hotel for whom that just want to use it as the place to sleep at night and go out during the day. Not a good hotel to spend your day in the room since its too small.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little bit more and get something better”
Reviews.Author: Corvolho
Reviews.Content: I didn't like this hotel at all. It is not the cleanest hotel I have ever been, for 2 days I didn't have any hot water, one day my room was not cleaned and I had to ask them to give me another bed sheet. The neighbourhood is not so good but it is close to the MRT Kallang. The wifi costs S$18 for 24 hours!!! I wish I had spent some more to be in a better place!

Reviews.Title: “Good value,”
Reviews.Author: CKJANICE
Reviews.Content: Consider the high hotel price in Singapore, this hotel truly offer good value, compare the cost of staying in the basic hostel, this is way better deal, you got a private room with own bathroom, close to transit, only 10 minutes walk to MRT (map is not very helpful, better ask people), lots bus within 2 minutes walking distance. lots local cheap eatries, we had banana prata SGD$2.50, chili crab, Singaporean style breakfast: Kaya bread, eggs and coffee that only cost SGD$2.00, many meal choice cost only SGD$5.00 or less (chicken on rice or shrimp noodles). Overall, this is great choice for people just look for basic accommdation.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel: don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: CocoaK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Emerald and overall it was okay. The cleanliness of the room was okay and liveable. They have the basics and i guess thats all you need but if thats not enough for you, go for three stars. If you are travelling on a budget this hotel is great for you but there is no free wifi which is a down side. The location of the hotel is good as it is near the kallang mrt and you will need to walk a short distance but please walk on the side that has grass on. The other side with shops walk there at night as the grass side is dark. Not to worry there is a pathway for you walk. I could not stand the smell coming from the drains so that why i recommend you to walk on the grass side. There is a bus stop but i don't recommend you to take the bus but take the mrt it is much better as they have maps for you to read. Also staff at every station will answer your questions if you have any queries. In Singapore the hotels are expensive and the rooms are small because Singapore is such a small island. Not really much to say about the hotel as it met my expectation of a budget hotel and i guess if you are travelling you want to go out until late. So the i have no troubles coming back again if i come back to Singapore in the future. I don't recommend it if you want a comfortable stay and like to stay in the hotel room for a long period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: TingLee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel booking directly from the website, which is not advisable since I had to remind them to sent me a confirmation after they charged my credit card. Book through Agoda or other websites, prices are the same and less problematic. In terms of location, this is about 10 min walk away from the Kallang MRT station and probably 15 min walk away from Aljunied MRT (sp?). Nice restaurants nearby and easy access to convenient shops, banks,..etc. Also easy to catch taxi but some taxis have problem finding the exact location of the hotel though they easily get you close by. Adult activities are close by but the hotel is more or less insulated from these elements - so no problem if you have children or want to avoid these. Hotel room is very basic but I find them clean and comfortable. Me and my buddy stayed for three days and no major complain since we are out most of the time. Services are spotty, some of the staff are friendly, other not so.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel , what else can you expect”
Reviews.Author: moonbeam05
Reviews.Content: the location is not close from the Geylang MRT station , you have to walk for 10 minutes to reach the hotel. they say that Geylang is Red light district but when i stayed there i didnt see any "working lady" around the hotel. the room is clean , the bathroom is very clean too but shame there is no separation in the shower area, everytime u finish shower the bathroom floor will get wet but still okay tho. the bed is clean and comfortable , they clean it everyday. the location is close to some restaurant , mini market. for $60 per night this is Good Budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “You gain what you paid!! A terrible experience here!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmyChiu
Reviews.Content: The location is not that close to the MRT, thus it's inconvenient. The room is clean but condition of bathroom is not that well due to no separated shower facilities. The service is soooo bad. They show no respects to their customers. Id booked separately but note then for 3 times before my arrival. As I checked in, I do note them that I wish to stay in the same room. They reply i can stay in the same room and check out on my departure date. However, they moved out my items and belongings without notify and permission next day morning. They just did it and let me know this in the evening as I was back to hotel. There is something missing of "helped packing". It's fine but all I want to do is to share my experience with all travelers who consider to stay this retail hotel. Think  twice and make your decisions wisely!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Management”
Reviews.Author: dprebble
Reviews.Content: Do not book with this hotel!!!!!!!!! I booked online with Agoda and asked for a queen bed for me and my wife. When I got there I checked in and went to the room. When we opened the door there were 2 single beds. I went down and complained. They told me that they can never confirm a queen bed. I asked why then offer it in booking options. They then told me that if I cancel I would have to forfeit a nights accommodation. VERY BAD SERVICE and reception staff were very rude. If you want to stay in this area go to the Fragrance Sapphire.

Reviews.Title: “"Very Disappointing" Stay away”
Reviews.Author: dyames
Reviews.Content: The room was very tiny, blanket was stained tub was dirty with no curtain, towel please dont use it, and mug oh please the mug was very very filthy, so filthy that i want to put some water in it and ask the rude receptionist which of course a common for singaporean service to drink on it and feel the way i felt when i saw that mug. Wifi! there is but you have to pay 5 dollars for only 2 hours imagine paying USD 60 for your room and an additional fee for a wifi. There were no nothing no fridge no chair no table to put your bag no space to work on your things just the basic hard break your back matress and mirror. For TV there were only 3 channels and that was in primitive chinese and in Malay I guess. Good thing you dont have to pay to store your bag if in case your flight is beyond your check out time, but of course singaporean service you will place the bag yourself to a room they point using their lips pointing 2 rooms infront of them, choose the left door by the way, and you will also be given a tag which you yourself will put on the bag, and when you figure out which room will you put your bags the door was locked tsk tsk tsk. Service was really terrible they need to be retrained. Location it is 15 min walk from the nearest train station, ok you want to ride a bus to go to the train station you still have to do a long walk. It is far from tourist spot a train ride. But it is near if you fancy indian people and places. My suggestion if you have any other option please stay there not here it will ruin your vacation

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much for budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrDiAnArY
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel for a cheap price and good location (near the bus stop and easy to reach MRT station) I was there 3 nights with family room the room is not tiny as i thought, but i have to consider about bathroom cleanness. Staff (at daytime are very nice & helpful but i was frustrated with staff at nighttime) Though this hotel is on the red-light area but it's dangerous as it should be, and since 3 nights i'd been there i didn't see anything related to the red-light at all. and you can leave your baggage at the hotel after check-out

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for a budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: syarlilady
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night to attend a concert at Singapore Indoor Stadium. On Google or Streetdirectory map, it seems like Kallang and Aljunied MRT Stations are near but appreantly you have to walk quite a distance. Unfortunately, there was no direct way to the Stadium. With the MRT, you have to exchange to Circle Line at Paya Lebar MRT. Even the bus doesn't take you straight to the Stadium. You still have to walk. Taxis are abundant though and the hotel Reception staff would call a taxi for you if you ask. I chose a double room even though I was travelling solo. Small room but for a 5-ft tall girl like me, it was fine. TV was old and the antenna reception wasn't so good. I was satisfied with the basic complimentary items i.e toothbrush, instant coffee sachets. Basic facilities were mini electric kettle, hairdryer, mugs, spoons. The buttons on the Air-Cond control unit were missing but me, being an employee in an electronic factory, figured out which things to press anyway. The cupboard/closet/wardrobe was spacious enough to fit my overnight bag and hang my jacket and jeans. The bathroom was clean and spacious enough for me to move about comfortably. I wish there was a mini fridge though. I was aware of it being in the "Red District" but I did not see any scantly clad woman there. Well, the area was full of Iron Maiden fans in black t-shirts that night anyway. But I did get curious, wondering if there is any trace of this place's linkage to the area's reputation. Guess what? I found one piece of pubic hair on the floor. A-hah!! Sleep quality : I slept like a log. No incident of noisy travellers in the next room or such. But I just went to Iron Maiden concert at full blast, any noise after that became a whisper. Dislike: The girl at the Reception didn't smile AT ALL!! Will I stay here again? Yes, if there is any concert at the Stadium because it is the best value for money and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good for value, minus for bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Veeranu
Reviews.Content: There are no much cheaper places to sleep in singapore, so this one is pretty good for budget travellers. Clean and pretty calm hotel. Could recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Just "for a sleep"hotel”
Reviews.Author: cloudyf
Reviews.Content: Far from both Kallang and Aljunied MRT Stn. but u can reach here by bus which is a good way if u prefer not to walk..room is small but it's okay for 2. Basic facilities are provided except the refrigerator :(...Delicious Dim Sum restaurant nearby (it was good for me haha)..It is quite good hotel if u r here to sleep and take a shower..no breakfast but there's 7-11 nearby and some delicious coffeeshops open early in the morning ..will go back since I get used to this hotel and around Geylang!!interesting place :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent place in a good location for night life”
Reviews.Author: Cameronjpu
Reviews.Content: Not the nicest hotel but the neighborhood is not sketchy, and is easily reached by cab, bus or metro from downtown. This is a good area to stay in if you want relatively cheap and late nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, basic hotel in an easy access location”
Reviews.Author: sherveen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from expedia at the rate of £33 a night for 2 nights for my stay over in Singapore and 1 night in return. The hotel is clean, basic and is in a good location for a massive selection of eating places. This is located within 10 minute walking distance to the Kallang MRT. Despite being in the red-light district, I didn't feel unsafe or never got approached by any touts for women. I was happily roaming around at night browsing through the many eating places on offer on Geyland Road. My criteria for choosing a hotel is cleanliness and value for money. Singapore is a city of expensive hotels so finding something cheap that gives you decent crash pad is hard to come by. which is why this hotel was ok for me. The staff can be a bit more courteous and look a bit happier than look like grumpy people just doing their job. In Summary: What I liked: a) Location. Easy access to EW line MRT Kallang stop. short trip to the airport on the MRT and 2 stops to the city centre. b) Price c) Cleanliness d) Good Air con e) good hot water supply f) complimentary coffee, water cups and kettle in the room g) Towels changed daily and beds made, but not new bed linen (not like I change my bed linen at home daily) h) LCD TV What I disliked: a) Tiny rooms, barely any room to move around the room let alone keep any luggage, but not a big issue for me as I travelled with my backpack and by myself, so the spare bed was my store area. b) Bathrooms don't have shower enclosures or curtains. When you shower the whole bathroom gets wet. Not a biggie if you shower after you go to the toilet. THe water drains quickly and is dry when you go out for the day and return to the room later in the day c) no free internet , 2 hours for S$5+ . Not acceptable for a technology savvy country like Singapore where internet is now almost a basic necessity. d) Very noisy passages. Every move in the communal area including the doors being shut can be heard inside the room. e) the bed sheets were clean but I don't think the blankets were necessarily very clean The pros above were good for me and the cons were not an issue to me as my soul intention was to have a crash pad for the nights I was in SIngapore where I spent most the day out venturing around Singapore and for me to return to the hotel, shower and sleep in a clean room. therefore depending on your expectations from a hotel, this hotel can be your cup of tea and may not be your choice. After all you get what you pay for and is decent at that too. I think my view is pretty balanced and honest as I don't expect Marina Bay Sands hotel standard from a £30 a night Fragrance emerald hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, clean, but far from centre”
Reviews.Author: Hikari_PL
Reviews.Content: Pros: clean, brand new inside, fair price. Cons: location outside city centre, paid internet, small roms. Generally taking into account price to quality the hotel looks ok.

Reviews.Title: “good rate”
Reviews.Author: sunmi
Reviews.Content: I just backed and had stayed here 3 nights, booking by agoda. Room rate is 47$/ night, double bed, small room but ok. Clean, near Kallang MRT, near fog leg restaurant. Go around " red light" at night is good, bedding change daily.

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice made in a rush”
Reviews.Author: Garry T
Reviews.Content: A last minute itinerary change by our airline meant an overnight stay on route to Vietnam we chose this hotel for its location close to the airport and price after all its just one night. Bad choice surly staff tiny room approx 18 inches either side of the double bed and 3 feet at the foot ( thats the room size ) plus a tiny bathroom and a scruffy old stained blanket on the bed.If this is a sample of the Fragrance chain then avoid them. Plus its location is in an older part of town and the reaction from the locals tells you tourists are rarely seen.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Fragrance because we wanted cheap accommodation in Singapore so we could make the most of our time there seeing other attractions, We stayed 3 nights. Very small room and bathroom, no shower curtain over bath - but we coped. No Fridge, jug didn't work. But kept clean and bedding changed daily. Staff were helpful enough and we only really slept there. They have internet you can pay to use which was good. Wasn't too far from the trains. Stay was good for the pocket and if you plan to only sleep there you should be able to cope for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience. rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Sunkissedguy
Reviews.Content: worse hotel ever! the staff are very rude. they need to undergo training i guess.the rooms are ok. no shower curtains or anything that would isolate the toilet from the shower so everything is wet when someones taking a bath. no free wifi. wifi is ridiculously expensive. they dont want to bring extra pillows to guests because they say they are fully booked. i will never stay here ever,

Reviews.Title: “kid-friendly, good on the budget”
Reviews.Author: angeladelmar
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my older kids in march, and again in june, this time, together with the younger kids ages 6 and 10. although there are no facilities for the kids to play in, the hotel was okay since we were out all day. we took two rooms, one family room that had a queen bed and a single bed, and one double room. the price of the 2 rooms was still lower than the price of just 1 room in other areas around singapore (i.e, orchard road, etc.). the rooms were tiny, but they were clean. the aircon worked well, there was cable tv with kid channels. coffee maker was provided. there was no mini-ref, but there is a large one at the lobby where we placed our drinks. water pressure from the shower was strong and steady. lt was easy to get around singapore with fragrance emerald as our base, thanks to http://gothere.sg where we got detailed directions on how to travel from one area to another, and which mode of transportation to take (bus, train, or taxi). there are many restaurants and eateries close to the hotel, 7-11's are a few minutes walk away, so are the bus stops. the hotel's filipina front desk staff were warm, friendly and helpful. although fragrance emerald is located in the 'red light' district (geylang) we did not see any prostitutes around the vicinity of this hotel, not even during the other times we stayed here. this made the hotel more kid-friendly than those on the other streets in geylang.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel for a traveller on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Marlen15
Reviews.Content: The location was good because it is in the center of all known tourists destinations. If you are looking for a modest hotel that you can comfortably sleep in during the night, this hotel would be it. The rate is relatively affordable so you shouldn't expect much. The family room is small but the beds can comfortably accommodate four. No slippers, lotions, cotton buds, cotton, comb, free-wifi, and breakfast. Power plug adapters are available in the lobby but you should deposit S$5. Many nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “NOT Horrible and NOT Worst,Tolerable but NOT Satisfying”
Reviews.Author: AliPd
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel was good, it was near train station and also it was not too far from city centre for taking taxi. It was not too clean and facility of hotel was limited. It was dusty and hairs could be find on the room floor. There is no slipper inside room and it was not appropriate for using bathroom. However, room was not smelly and the old air conditioner was working properly. From my opinion for 2-night stay and for budget price is tolerable but not satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Err... red light district?”
Reviews.Author: BellaJudy
Reviews.Content: Not suitable to ladies & families. Prostitutes standing around each corner, even in broad daylight!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: dancingqueenuk
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful at reception. The room was OK but it smelt a bit of mothballs which wasn't great. When you had a shower, it was a wet room so you had to wait a fair while before all the water went and you could use the sink without getting wet feet! It was quite a good location, where you could walk to the metro which is really nice and handy. It was quite reasonably priced which is why we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “A decent budget choice in a pricey hotel market”
Reviews.Author: TripVisorAustralia
Reviews.Content: Accommodation in Singapore is expensive and so the Fragrance hotels are a good budget option. I believe Emerald is the best of the lot. Geylang is of course a red light area, but the seediness is limited and not pushy like in some other big cities, and its location near to the airport is very convenient. There are also some great restaurants and a plethora of convenience stores nearby. The hotel is very simple and although its cleanliness is questionable (I wouldn't be touching the blankets), the rooms have most of the things you need. There are no frills but if you're prepared for that you'll be happy with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Wan_Tong
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the cheaper end of the scale and provides appropriate value for money. The room was clean and pleasant and the airconditioning worked well - all I needed for an overnight stay in Singapore. Nearby Chinese restaurants provide plenty of eating options.

Reviews.Title: “A NICE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: lockbloom
Reviews.Content: We and my wife spent a night on our way to Europe and we've totally enjoyed the room and the service as well. This hotel have got a subway's direct connection to the airport which is good for a quick stopover.

Reviews.Title: “i wouldn't even stay here for free”
Reviews.Author: katiebella_11
Reviews.Content: This place was possibly the worst hotel room I have ever stayed in. To arrive into Singapore and to stay in this hotel was a complete let down. Thankfully we had only booked this place for one night...but even then, I had the worst sleep I had had on my 12 day trip overseas. The room was really grubby, the bed was simply a lino mattress with a sheet on top and a dirty old blanket (no doona and no mattress protector). The shower was a low lying shower head (think only going as high as your waist) over a bathtub with no curtain and rust in the bathtub). The service was okay but not impressive and the location was not the best and a bit out of the centre of it all. The next night we stayed in the centre of things for 3-4 times the price and it was happily paid. There is no way I could have stayed in that hotel for another night. We stayed in Bangkok budget accommodation for half the price and it was ten times better. Honestly, I just cannot believe that someone could provide a hotel room in the state that that room was in and call it "deluxe". I would be ashamed. Don't be fooled by the pics like we were, it was terrible. I can understand that maybe this would be better than a dorm room in a backpacker lodge but I am still not convinced.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive room, Bad location, Huge turnoff”
Reviews.Author: Steve_KL
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here for 5days on my business trip to Singapore suntec city exhibition. My first impression was the girls standing on the street walk ways. Obviously we dont get to see this type of scenes back in Malaysia. Later then i found out that this place called . "Geylang" is actually a red-light district. Check-in wasnt bad, but the room priced at SGD100/night was too expensive for this hotel. About RM250/night in KL i can easily find better hotels. Room was very very basic , no internet, no fridge, no bathtub & nothing fancy. At night the place becomes spooky, outside of the hotel will be filled with china/thai girls for short time escort. Most irritating part was whenever you get in & out, you will be invited/chatted by this girls or pimps. Food in geylang is nice, but overall its too far from city center & environment isnt good.

Reviews.Title: “Purely Budget”
Reviews.Author: sundar_amu
Reviews.Content: Its purely budget hotel. You can't expect anything other than a Bed for sleep. There is no common rest room in hotel which is much disappointed. This place is not good for INDIANS. All hotels are Chinese... you gets only smelly chicken, duck, frog, snail, fish etc... We searched almost an hour to find an Indian restaurant. I recommend to spend few more dollars to find some other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: tuanchao
Reviews.Content: I only booked this place for 2 nights and it was cheap b/c it was in the red light district. I love the neighborhood, great food and shops and close to buses and connection to the airport. It wasn't seedy at all. However, the hotel facilities were so out of date! No remote control for the TV? And we had to pay for wifi in the room, which didn't even work pass 30min b/c the connectivity was so poor! The reception guy claimed he couldn't give our money back b/c of hotel policy but he offered to pay out of his own pocket instead. Otherwise, the staff was not very helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: dumpling4
Reviews.Content: Very small room, old and noisy air con, no fridge, small old tv with no remote control, no curtain in the shower, no place to hang clothes in bathroom while taking shower, tea cups with coffee stains and distance away from MRT station (about 10-15mins walk from MRT station).

Reviews.Title: “poor room maintenance > health hazard”
Reviews.Author: hellnoi
Reviews.Content: Room 615 bath tub was in a very dangerous condition. The bath tub was broken and the spots had rusted. My guests had no choice but to move to alternate hotel the next day. My guests were holidaying from USA, and Vietnam I will appreciate if your management will look into this and at the least refund my charge.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accommodation but not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: Smalls1983
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in November 2010. We were back-packing for 4 months and it certainly wasn't the worst accommodation we had stayed in. Although it is in the Red Light District, we did not see anything seedy! The location was good, within walking distance to the Kallang MRT station and cheap travel into the main attractions. There is a good Chinese restaurant located at the end of the road from the hotel, with some funny karaoke going on! The hotel is lit up like a Christmas Tree outside and you can't miss it, although I would recommend getting directions before arriving! The internet was $1 for 15 minutes. However there were a few negative points: The room was tiny and we found lots black hairs all around the room. Also, there was no hot water. We wanted to extend our stay for a night and were told we couldn't do this as they had no rooms available so we would have to pay a higher rate. We weren't happy with this so paid to use the internet service there and booked another room of the same description at the same rate we originally paid, and we got to keep the same room so think they were just trying to con us out of money!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you check the room before you accept it”
Reviews.Author: Penguin_990
Reviews.Content: We booked a "deluxe" room over the internet, when we checked in we were directed to room on the first floor, when we openedthe door if smelt like stale cigarette smoke and had a matress on the floor. We immediately went down to reception where the girl was suprised we didn't want the room with a matress on the floor. When I reminded her what room pictures look like on the internet she gave us another room.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here unless you really can't afford better”
Reviews.Author: Greeneyes1988
Reviews.Content: after travelling for 3 months and staying in 4* hotels to run down backpacking hostels in Australia i can officially say this was our worst accommodation we stayed at in our entire trip. Me and my boyfriend slept very badly due to the rubber mattress (the bed sheets kept slipping off) and the wheels on the bed making the bed roll across the room every time one of us turned over in our sleep. Although the size of the room was as i expected it was filthy dirty and had a very "creepy" feel to it. we both woke up to horrific sickness for 24hours- which we have put down to the drink we had from the vending machine of the hotel as this was the only thing we both had that was the same- admittedly it may have been some thing else- but be aware of drinking straight from the cans!

Reviews.Title: “Good price for quality”
Reviews.Author: jokoxd
Reviews.Content: Close to the Kallang MRT station (about a 10-15 minute walk), clean room which comes with water, coffee & extra toothbrushes and lots of eateries nearby. I asked for a single and the room was on the small side (there was no room to really walk after putting down my northface duffel bag) but very tidy. They even provide tv with news/sports/movie channels. You can get pretty much anywhere in Singapore once you get to an MRT station so in terms of accessibility, quality, and price, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanneHongKong
Reviews.Content: Worthes the price. Safe for women. Not so close to smrt, many foof stalls around

Reviews.Title: “Nice,Clean and Pleasant Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: mand-mcr
Reviews.Content: Although it was a little difficult to find this hotel initially, i found it to be in quite a good location, only 10-15 mins from the city with very easy tranport links. The room was exceptionally clean and well worth the little extra it cost over a hostel to have a little privacy, air conditioning and my own bathroom. This would probably be a little 'snug' for two people but if you're just resting your head it is more than ample to see you through a trip to this beautiful city. A little tip, if you get the MRT from the airport(highly recommended as its soooo cheap) when you exit the station cross the road at the lights directly opposite down going down Lor 1 Geylang away from the station and turn left on to Geylang Road. Walk for approx 6 mins until you see Lor 6 on the other side of the road, the hotel is the second one down. In the whole time i was there i only saw two 'ladies of the night' and even though i was travelling alone, i never felt uneasy or unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a budget deal”
Reviews.Author: rocktardhard
Reviews.Content: Singapore was our first country apart from our south East Asia tour and well, it was a good and everything was going quite well. It was a bit hard to find a budget hotel in this pricey country that is one of the reasons why we chose this hotel. Also, this place was our second hotel which we have ever stayed in here after spending 1 night at the hotel at the airport. We deserve what we pay for, so we were quite pleased with our hotel. Everything including the room, service, location was good. Good hotel for a budget deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very enjoyable stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bestkeptsecrets
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Asia Rooms and although we had the booking reference number the hotel staff said they hadn't received notification so we had to pay the current room rate for the hotel. One of the staff members at reception was extremely rude and has no idea about the concept of good customer service. The room we were given had a foul smell so we asked for a room change which was done with no problems except the night staff failed to tell the day staff that we had changed so the room wasn't made up the next day. The beds at this hotel are really hard and covered in thick vinyl overlays so it was really difficult to get a good night's rest. The location was convenient and access to taxis and public transport was good.

Reviews.Title: “fragrance emerald”
Reviews.Author: mawieIllionois
Reviews.Content: In fairness to this hotel, its a very nice place to stay. :-) they're rooms are clean as well as the bathroom. daily room cleaning is done without asking them to do it unlike other hotels. linens are changed everyday, and they give you new towels, a box of tissue, toothbrush, shower cap, drinking water, and coffee everyday. so everything is great and we enjoyed our stay there. thumbs up for fragrance emerald. thank you for your nice service.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Leeduf
Reviews.Content: After reading a few negative reviews for this hotel,i was a bit concerned about the quality of my stay in Singapore..WOW..what a surprise!!Yes,it was in the "red-light" district,but very tame compared to similar areas in other countries.We were travelling in a group of 4 women and not once during our stay,did we feel harrassed or frightened.In fact the people were very friendly and respectful,as were the lovely reception staff at the hotel. The rooms are small but immaculately clean.The room was serviced daily by friendly cleaning staff,who also catered to our needs when we asked for more towels,extra bottled water etc.The air conditioning worked well,cooling us down at night after our indulgent shopping expeditions to Singapores many shopping malls!!Thjere were a couple of computers for guests to use with a cost of $1sng per 15 mins,which i found to be reasonable. The Geylang area has a myriad of eateries(some of which are open 24/7..) in the immediate area as well as a 7 Eleven store around the corner.The favoured mode of transport for our group was taxis.Cheap and extemely efficient,we found it to be a quicker ( and cooler choice) of transport,though there is an MRT station not far from the hotel. Our return flight to Australia was not till late on the final evening but the hotel staff were more than happy to store our luggage till we were ready to leave.I will be definately staying there again on future visits to Singapore,and will confidently reccomend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: klaus227
Reviews.Content: First we had a small room in the highest level with a beautiful view to the skyline of Singapore, but our neighbours were noisy. So we asked to change and we got room 405 which was - compared to the price - very good. Bigger than the other, clean and quiet. But this always depends on the neighbours you have. I think they had a renovation shortly. Ok, what you expect for the price they offer? Our room was on the street-side, so it was hard to open the window. But the aircon was not noisy at all. They offer internet in the lobby, but you get it a lot cheaper in Geylang-Road. No own Restaurant, but a very cheap softdrink-automat in front of the hotel. What I didn't like - that we had to pay our whole stay (7 days) on arrival at the reception. So first we had to go to the money-changer because we didn't know that. Thanks God, there's one nearby. And we looked at the room first. The environment is excellent - a lot of restaurants, shops, internet-cafes, MRT and bus-stops and short distance to the airport. We recommend the (of course) chinese restaurant on opposite side of Geylang-Road, on the left. Sorry, I don't remember the name, they're on the corner to a small side-street and its an open restaurant (see picture). We would stay there again and maybe some day, when all the huge constructions in Singapore are finished, we will.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but good service”
Reviews.Author: KimMint
Reviews.Content: The room stayed in was clean, a bit small but good bed. The staff worked effectively and friendly. I stayed with my wife, we felt quite comfortable and we will recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: eezaway
Reviews.Content: The room was small BUT very clean. Slight problem with the aircon unit, but a quick call to the very friendly and very helpful reception staff, and it was fixed within an hour. Can get a little noisy at times (I had a party of students on my floor and I don't think quiet door-closing was part of their curriculum!) Handy for the MRT at Kallang + bus stop 200 metres away if you're travelling into town. Local area very safe - Cafe/Bar at the junction of Lorong 6/Geylang Road is highly recommended - good food and cheap beer + the owner and staff are very friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: yblieb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is mediocre at best. Nothing really much to write favourably but that it was cheap. And it felt cheap. The staff were unfriendly and had faces that said they were there because they needed to pay the bills. The room was small and felt tacky. A cockroach greeted me as I walked in the room. The outside of the hotel blended in with the general red-light district as it was in bright neon signage. I have stayed at better budget accomodation in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for a Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MBear2126
Reviews.Content: I stayed there this summer with my family. Despite the latest poor reviews, its actually really not that bad. There ARE prostitutes outside on the road, but they don't approach you if you're with your family, etc. they're not dumb. And as for noise, I can't really complain as there was none. Overall: Bathroom is clean Sheets are clean (as far as I can tell) Daily turndown service No noise other international budget travelers (like students etc.) I would recommend this to other people. Although its a small distance to the subway. Lotsa food to eat around the area!

Reviews.Title: “Practical and cheap for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: SoJakarta
Reviews.Content: We were staying there while on transit during a long trip. The hotel is very clean, very practical. The rooms are a decent size, on the small side, but all in all is a good value for money if you just need a place to sleep and not more.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: Tachin321
Reviews.Content: I didn't like it at all. Room was not very clean, was small, the area is not nice. I did see many prositutes around (more than 10). Walls were quite thin, which made it difficult to sleep at night (you could hear the other guests in their rooms). If I ever come back to Singapore I will def. not stay here. Would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay !!”
Reviews.Author: KarmicThoughts
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a dark street, the rooms are small and the staff is the worst i have experienced. The lady at the receptionist sold me internet card and when it didnt work she fought with me to prove me wrong. Bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “a short stay over in singapore”
Reviews.Author: levend
Reviews.Content: Fragrance Emerald Hotel situates on Lorong 6 of Geylang Road. I booked a room for three nights via the internet site Wotif. Months ahead i kept an eye on different sites that offers hotels in singapore. Looking for some favorable deal or promotion. But Singapore is not Bangkok where you can find four or five star hotel at a cheap price. I found some interesting offers of new hotels but somehow it was at a rather far corner of the island or far from a MRT station. I considered some private places. Guys offering a guestroom and the idea of having personal contact instead of an anynomous hotelroom seemed appealing but again it didn't work out. So i ended up again with the choice i made the previous times before. A budget hotel in the geylang area that is situated between the airport and the center, easy accessible by the MRT. I came to appreciate the area. Described as a red light district or a 'low-end' place. It is but it is surely more than that. When it comes to cleaniness and organization it can be compared to the same level as some of the better areas of any European city. Restaurants and cheap eateries everywhere. Most hotels offer one hour stay and is the terrain of a lot of female sexworkers but nowhere this turns the streets in a seedy and unsafe place like in the West. No posh shopping malls here but a vibrant streetlife at night. I read that new immigrants of mostly mainland China start their new life here and it gives the area for sure a more chinese instead of a western feeling you find in so many other places. And it keeps the prices down. And makes it an affordable place for a 'price conscious' traveller as i am. I don't know about the origins of the Fragrance hotel chain. They have several branches in this area but also in other ares of Singapore. It is a kind of 'no frills' place: small clean rooms with everything you need as a temporal visitor. Everything works what is needed: hot water, air conditioning, television, large bed. Two Stars. No breakfast or restaurant facilities. Minimal staff. Chinese impersonal service. Overpriced internet facilities but you find cheap alternatives around the corner. Don't expect something stylish, this is not Ibis. I booked a superior double room. The description of the room sounds: a small but decent size room with an ensuite bathroom. Indeed, before i must have book another type of room - i think 'deluxe'; it was a rather indecent sized room, i could hardly move around the bed and i found nearly no space to open my suitcase… This time i was housed with a room looking out on the streetfront and at the third level. The queen size bed is meant for two adults. For a single traveler as myself the room and the bed were in that case more than satisfying and that for a 'decent' price as well; for two person it would have been a bargain. For the first time i tried out the wireless service. The reception lady showed me the rates and explained something in Singlish. 10 singapore dollars for 10 hours of access seemed a good deal. When i logged on, the connection was there right away. It was only the next morning that i discovered some less pleasant side of this purchase and it was printed in a clear message on the sales ticket: 'Once activated, the time starts to run even though you may have logged out.' I guess i only used around two hours.. Not very practical if you wanna use the internet only for checking your mail or look for some information. So better go back around the corner to one of the internet cafés where they charge only 1,5 dollar for one hour…

Reviews.Title: “Compact Rooms for a Compact Price”
Reviews.Author: Xavier_uk
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay in Singapore for a couple of nights and the Singapore Stopover was a bit too expensive after the first night. So I decided to stay for 2 nights at the Fragrance Emerald hotel as one of the highest rated value hotels. The location I found to be okay, there was alway plenty of people around so did not feel uncomfortable either during the day or at night. It is a 10 minute walk to the MRT station although this does involve crossing several roads. There are many dining options at the end of the road. The check in was easy and the entrance was clean. My room looked onto the back of the hotel and was quiet at night, so I was happy. My room was compact!! I could only open my suitcase fully in two location, on the double bed and in the hallway to the bathroom/wet room. The bathroom was a wet room. This means that the shower (you need to put the heater on for hot water) was at one corner and the water drained in the centre of the bathroom. The bed was comfortable which was nice surprise. The aircondtioning worked although it had seen better days. Yes the rooms have thin walls but most of the noise comes from the corridor which I found more annoying. The room is cleaned each day as is the corridors. Another nice surprise was that 2 free bottles of water were supplied each day. Would I come back again to this hotel, yes but only after the first night of the Singapore Stopover. Odd things about the hotel When I was checking in I realised that the hotel offered "Transit Rates" for 1-6 hours. This is odd as it is a long way from the Airport and I do not think that anybody would be able to realy find this hotel straight off a plane. Read into this what you think, but I think other reviewers have explained what happens/may happen!!!! Please note that during my stay I did not see nor hear anything odd.

Reviews.Title: “Fragrance Emerald Hotel, Singapore, Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Zyxwvu
Reviews.Content: Although not in the centre of Singapore it was easy to reach via the metro (Kallang or Lavender stations) or by bus (easier if luggage). Both reasonably priced. Note address is 20 Lorong 6 Geylang (one on internet was incorrect so it caused some confusion finding it). Warm welcome. Quiet. Clean. Good facilities including lift. Very helpful reception staff, able to infrom us what bus numbers to look out for and where to find the bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: thai_and_beyond
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of some hotels in this price range we were pleasantly surprised at the room we had at fragrance Emerald. Sure it is small - just enough space to walk each side of the bed, tiny bathroom. But it is a budget hotel, we felt secure, the room was clean and tidy, as we live in Thailand we weren't surrpised by how small/compact everything was. We booked online and no problem when we arrived to check in; can't comment on other floors but ours (5th) had been recently redecorated/painted in the hallways. room was adequate - bed OK, aircon worked, clean bathroom and great pressure from the shower. It was very quiet. Low tourist season and few guests but minimal noise from other resisdents, and as Lorong 4 and 6 are narrow one-way there is almost no traffic noise. The walk to Kallang MRT (train) station took us 12min, can go there to city or to Changi Aiirport (S$1.60), many buses though we relied on trains, and found taxis reasonably priced. We saw some nearby hotels - pleased Emerald is not one that offers rooms by the hour, for obvious reasons! Wouild recommend for budget/short stay for a couple, can't comment of family rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Far from MRT”
Reviews.Author: Nash09
Reviews.Content: The bed had bugs on the first night. Small cockroaches were coming out from underneath the small opening from behind the TV. I killed 3 and i think that's the whole family or probably the young ones managed to elude me. The air-conditioning unit was making a lot of noise. Can't sleep at night for all the 2 nights i was there. The toilet is clean though and the toiletries are fine. It is also far from the Red light district so you don't get pestered by you know who ;) The bed was not that comfortable. The price is cheap and the hotel is close to the main road but Far from the MRT...you have to walk for 18 minutes to reach the MRT with your luggage. The taxi from the hotel was also very expensive. They always charge for service. The receptionist called a very expensive taxi for me in the morning to drive to the airport and it cost me 10 SGD more than the usual fare.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with small rooms and thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Chrizzie1982
Reviews.Content: Luckily we only stayed for one night at that hotel. A lot of noise during the night, apparently very thin walls. STAFF: We only saw the staff during the check in. We were at the hotel at 11.00 AM and had to wait until point 12.00 AM to check in. Annoying "Christmas"-tootling-"music" at the reception desk. The concierge did her job but was not very friendly. LOCATION: The location could be better. We had to take a Taxi to go to town. It wasn't a long ride after all, maybe 10 minutes. ROOM: The standard room with two beds was clean, the bathroom ok. Nevertheless we had a hard time to do the one thing we wanted there: sleep! The walls must be very thin, the ceilings aswell. We heard someone talking in chinese somewhere above our room, also screaming and door-banging on our floor (or maybe also one floor above us - who knows). CONCLUSION: Simply look for a different hotel. In this one you won't be able to sleep unless you are deaf or you have a good set of earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Place”
Reviews.Author: travelnow2929
Reviews.Content: Good location. The hostel is cleaner compare to the ones I've been to, and the price is nice and affordable. Although I would have preferred to have my own bathroom, overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for money”
Reviews.Author: Expana
Reviews.Content: Location is good. Staff - friendly and helpful. We arrived late at nigh, but check-in was fast. We booked tween room to save money, but they kindly gave us a room with one queen bed for the same price. The only thing I didn't like was a cigarettes smell going from the bed. The next day bedding was changed and it almost didn't smell. I can't tell was the smell from the bedding itself or from the outside corridor/other room, because there were no much smell in the corridor. Just to mention - no fridge in the room, no bath - just shower and water goes to the floor directly. So if you want to take a shower you need to put something on you feet. In room - TV. Kettle, tea, cups with water. Small wardrobe. Internet is available for SGD18 per 24h but we didn't tried it. If you have a lot of baggage with with you or large bags, there is too little space for them. A lot of places where to have food are near the hotel. We also was able to go to the City by feet in less than about half an hour. If you don't stay at the hotel all the day and use it just for sleeping, the hotel is fine. Especially for such a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “My pick as great value budget hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: lyndy23
Reviews.Content: Second stay at Fragrance Emerald in the past 12 months, both stays booked on wotif/last minute websites. Both stays paid around AUD50...small clean rooms, compact bathroom, jug provided and free coffee in room. Internet access in room 10hrs wi-fi 10SGD or 2hrs 5 SGD. Staff helpful and friendly. Requested quiet higher floor room with 2 beds (I like to spread out and review my shopping purchases!) Good television reception with limited cable channels but variety OK for me. Overall this hotel is well managed, clean, close to transport and if you request a quiet room for sleeping you probably won't be stuck next to "comings & goings' nightly!!!! The cafe on the cnr of Lorong 6 has tasty cheap buffet with vegetables, noodles, chicken and rice for under SGD4. Great Tiger beer SGD5.50 a bottle. Good place to watch the partying folks!

Reviews.Title: “Best for money...”
Reviews.Author: Dinindu
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 days in this hotel with my wife. Place was clean & the staff was pleasant, even though the room was small. However the room which my friends stay was larger than out one. It had everything i need, so i'm quite happy & recommend this hotel if you search for a low cost place while still having everything you need. Dinindu - Sri Lanka

Reviews.Title: “knock knock matters”
Reviews.Author: Kim0933666817
Reviews.Content: hookers knocked my door every night...... the room is way too small very nice price however~~

Reviews.Title: “Should be renamed Hotel Insomnia,whatever you do don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: effies1961
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but clean, hotel staff accommodating, just-Daytime however completely different to the night time-The running of high heels outside your room, the banging of the fire exit doors and the bashing of some poor sod in the hallway outside your door, complete with someone screaming and yelling in asian.This went on ALL night too!Hotel by day,brothel by night whatever you do, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet in Singapore for the value-conscious”
Reviews.Author: Cbirch70
Reviews.Content: Been wanting to write a review since I got back a week ago. I booked the first three of my 7 days in Singapore at this hotel. I figured I'd see it before I committed for the whole week. My only concern was that there was no room safe, and no hotel safe. After the three days, I easily decided to stay for the following reasons: Ultra clean room, excellent value paid 35USD) and fun nightlife in the area. The red-light-district status was not a deterrent, as it really isn't that visible unless you're aware or looking for it. Yes, they rent the rooms out hourly, but so does nearly every Geylang hotel. Why folks pay upwards of 200USD or rooms downtown in beyond me. A typical evening downtown costs a fortune. In Geylang, around this hotel, you can eat and drink for next to nothing, and chat with the locals, the best part of any trip (imho). Cafe 218 is right around the corner. Everything you need. The staff was friendly once I got to know the, . The rooms were cleaned frequently ad very thoroughly. One of the cleanest rooms I have stayed in a long time. As others have noted, it's 10 minutes to Kallang Station, and though it might look far, all the great places are nearby. East Coast Park is a 25 minute walk. Recommended to everyone except families, of course. There simply isn't enough room. If you like immersion with the locals, it's for you. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & good location”
Reviews.Author: Kimiko_Lai
Reviews.Content: Bus stops are nearby the hotel and about 10 mins walk to the nearest MRT station. Rooms are small but tidy. There are many many food shops along the road outside the hotel. Next time when I visit Singapore again, I will be stay with this hotel again ^^

Reviews.Title: “Good value, if you can adapt”
Reviews.Author: ploughman8
Reviews.Content: Looks like the pricing on sites like Expedia is steering LOTS of budget-conscious international travelers to the Fragrance Hotels now. It was priceless to see the confused look on the faces of a Korean couple, for example, as the taxi dropped them off in the parking lot. Geylang isn't on any of the numerous official "tourist maps" of Singapore. I had been there before, and had done my homework on TA, choosing the Fragrance Emerald from 5 or 6 identically priced choices that were all among the few really budget options offered via Expedia for an increasingly pricey Singapore. For me it worked out well. A taxi from the airport on day non-peak rate was around S$16 and got there pretty quickly. It was around noon and they didn't have rooms ready yet for my category, so I opted to store the bags and go around town for 2 or 3 hours rather than paying an upcharge for a higher grade (mine was a queen room). The room was smallish, but clean, well-kept and with most things working. "Small" in Singapore is still about twice the size of "small" in Hong Kong, and this place was larger and much better and nicer than the backpacker places I remember from Bencoolen (now gone to make way for hotels). As for location, it's about a 10-15 minute walk to Kallang MRT, which is the closest from that side of Geylang. If you stay closer to Lorong 20 and up you're nearer to Aljunied MRT and it's likely a shorter walk. Geylang is well-supplied with hawker places for food or with convenience stores, though international franchises like McDonald's would require a taxi, bus or MRT ride out of the area. As for the red-light status, the area looks like any other in Singapore by day, and by night Lorong 6 was pretty quiet. Lor 10 & 12 had what girls there were walking around (mostly Indonesian), and Lor 18 and 20 have the Thai "fishbowl" places. The situation could change, but Lorong 6 was a good bet for being lower-key and away from the diminished amount of activity in other blocks. Geylang has an amazing number of hotel rooms for an area of several blocks not even on tourist maps, but it appears that overbuilding + a crackdown on streetwalkers (i.e. enforcing immigration policy) has led to hotels having to attract longer stayers. My room was on the fourth floor and away from whatever short-term traffic they had over the course of 2 weekdays...in most places the lower floors are kept for the hourly customers and the higher floors for the longer-stayers, though there could be some mixing of room assignments on a busy weekend, I'd imagine. Overall I'd conditionally recommend for seasoned budget travelers and most everyone except families with children.

Reviews.Title: “As expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: nz_traveller_1234
Reviews.Content: Bit of a mixed bag, was going to book into another hotel @ $NZ130 per night but then thought I'd try Fragrance Emerald as it was only $NZ50 per night. I turned up early on my check in day, staff friendlt, early check in fee was goint to be at least $50 (same as a nights stay) so I got a room for 2 hours ($20) so I could shower and have a nap. Room was small but reasonably sized, clean, air con worked well and was quiet. Later that night I returned and got my originally booked room. Upon entering noticed air con was noisy and spotted a cockroach on the table, then another one near the bed. Made a hasty retreat to the reception and asked for another room which was given with a minimum of fuss. This room was roach free, clean and a reasonable size. However again the air con was noisy and I ended up turning it off to sleep. As for it been located in a 'red light district' it is a pretty tame one at that, I walked through the area at night and there were a couple of strip clubs and maybe a maximum of 3 prostitutes I saw on the street the whole time. It is in quite a good location, 5 minutes walk from the MRT station, then 2 or 3 stops from City Hall. Overall for the price I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Travellerporirua
Reviews.Content: I booked it through Hotel Club.com. The facilities were very good and this hotel is good value for money with very clean and tidy king size bed with clean linens, clean toilet and bath facilities and excellent air-conditioning when temps were soaring between 28 and 32 C. The matters for downgrading are: 1)It is located on notorious Geylang making it very embarrassing to see prostitutes and pimps lining up all the way soliciting all the time. Not a good place to stay if you are with family.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Longton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. We arrived about 8 am and were told our room would only be ready about 2 pm. So we left our bags and went into the city using the train system. The station is about 10 minutes walk away. We got back to the hotel at about 12.30 pm and found our room ready. It was fine and clean. We checked out at 4 am the next morning and the hotel arranged a taxi pick-up. We liked the neighbourhood. After wandering around the squeaky clean centre of town it was refreshing to get back to a lively district.

Reviews.Title: “Walk on the Wild Side”
Reviews.Author: camsean
Reviews.Content: Singapore has long been a challenging city for the budget traveller. For many years the only really cheap options were backpacker hostels with surly staff and sweaty vinyl mattresses. In recent years the situation has improved somewhat, especially if you are prepared to stay in the colourful Little India area of the city. But another viable option is The Fragrance Emerald Hotel, especially for those willing to 'walk on the wild side'. The main problem is the neighbourhood, as the hotel is situated right in the middle of Geylang, Singapore's red light district. For anyone who believes the hype that Singapore is squeaky clean and vice free, a walk through her will disabuse you of the notion. Come here of a night and you will see working class men sitting around drinking beer with bored-looking bar girls. In the street outside the hotel prostitutes stand about, soliciting clients. Yet once you are in the front door, you find a perfectly good hotel, at much less than you would pay elsewhere in the city. The rooms have comfortable beds, AC, TV and a clean bathroom. This is a reasonably priced option for anyone willing to look past the unsalubrious area.

Reviews.Title: “For S$60, an absolute steal”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within 10 - 12 minutes walk from Kalliang MRT railway station and has a 7- 11 across the road for late night snacks. Upon arrival the airconditioning at reception was a welcome relief from Singaporean humidity. The exterior of the hotel is garish with neon signage while my eighth (top) floor corridor had an unusual paint scheme - 'lime green' is the closest pantone colour that I can describe it as. Lighting in the room was terrific while the quiet airconditioning soon had the temperature down to 19 degrees. My room overlooked a freeway entrance but there was no traffic noise. The twin beds were comfortable while the small bathroom's shower worked well. There is no refrigerator. The room was immaculate save for a smidgeon of soap on the shower floor from the dispenser. The two towels provided were very small which was my only criticism. There are notably fewer prostitutes at this end of Geylang Road than closer to Aljunied MRT station. All in all, this hotel is easy to book through www.asiatravel.com and saves the hassle of dealing with Changi Airport's popular transit hotels which are more expensive for a 12 hour stay. The cost of the return trip on SMRT's MRT was S$2.80 and the one way travel time, including the walk, from Changi Airport to kalliang MRT 40 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “good price and good location”
Reviews.Author: hv111
Reviews.Content: not far from MRT kallang 10-15 min. walking and safety for woman

Reviews.Title: “Almost OK”
Reviews.Author: blooms_gardens
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid Fragrance Emerald thru the hotel's website. Reservation's recommended Emerald among all Geylang district Fragrance hotels. We arrived at the hotel at 1:00AM, and we were told that our booking was cancelled. We found this incredible because we booked only 3 weeks earlier and our credit card was billed. In fact, the hotel confirmed our booking. The receptionist told us to just pay them another 1 night stay so that they can check us in and they will call their booking office in the morning to clear things up. Since we were tired and sleepy, we paid them but insisted on using their computer first to email and complain to their reservation officer. They did refund us the money in the morning but the worry they gave us was terrible. Very ineffecient system. Anyway, the room we booked was a family room with queen and single beds. The room was small as expected. It has its own bathroom, hairdryer, purified water, thermos, tv, and quiet aircon. In fairness, the room was not so bad - affordable, clean and quiet. Even if it's located in the red light district, the street was relatively empty when we arrived at 1AM, no working girls loitering around. We would have stayed longer but the location is not near any shopping malls or tourist spots. We wanted a hotel within walking distance and the geylang area is not. But if taking the bus or train is not time consuming for you then the area is okay.

Reviews.Title: “cheap, clean and ok with the right attitude”
Reviews.Author: neverwinter
Reviews.Content: booked through Asiarooms and all ok on arrival. 2nd visit here so we know what to expect; the room is a little shabby but clean, the bedding and towels are changed daily and you get TV, your own shower room and kettle, coffee and water. Aircon cool and quiet, water hot. Room small of course but ok. It is just off Geylang Road and you can't hear the traffic, especially from a back room, but there is a building site at the rear at the moment so there will be some noise. This is a red light area, but it is Singapore so while it is obvious what is going on there doesn't seem to be any trouble. I get the impression that the hotel separates the 'short-time' clientele from the tourists so no-one gets disturbed. Geylang is cheap, lively and cheerful; we seem to be the only Europeans for miles but in cosmopolitan Singapore no-one hassles you or touts you. In fact we had a couple of locals get chatting! Lots of good food courts and restaurants around, about 10 mins walk to Kallang MRT and two nearby bus stops take you directly to the centre of Singapore. so yes, for a cheap but adequate hotel I would stay again, and provided you understand what to expect I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of attempted ripoff here”
Reviews.Author: HambledonTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel as the result of a last minute flight change. I booked and paid via Wotif.com at the Airport at 9pm and arrived at 10pm. They said they didn't have the booking - I gave them the booking number but they said that their Head Office was shut so I would have to pay them direct, they would confirm my Wotif booking in the morning and refund me my 2nd payment made directly to them. They refused to call Wotif's 24hr phone number to confirm my booking. They did not refund me when I left - they said Head Office would process the refund later that day. 3 weeks later they have not done so. Wotif have been chasing them including providing copies of my Mastercard chits and the note the Hotel gave me saying they would refund. Still no joy with the refund. I am not happy that I have paid this Hotel twice and that they are not being honest by refunding me the 2nd payment they insisted that I make before I could get into the room I had already paid for.

Reviews.Title: “For Budget Traveller Only”
Reviews.Author: Saranghae
Reviews.Content: If you stay at this hotel...you should aware that this hotel is located in the middle of Singapore's red light district that mean you'll see a numbers of "girl" going around this area all day long. For the hotel...it has a small lobby and absolutely it has a very small room and bathroom. We stayed for 4 nights in 2 family rooms...1 double bed and 1 single bed for each room...enough for 3 persons to sleep together. But there is almost no space for us to place our 3 bagages...it was very very difficult for us to open our bag. But the room and bathroom were very clean. And you can also rent the room by hourly rate. If you are on a tight budget...this hotel is really recommended

Reviews.Title: “A good budget option”
Reviews.Author: TripVisorAustralia
Reviews.Content: Singapore's a tough place to find good, cheap accommodation, so this hotel is a fair option, considering. It comes with everything you need except for a fridge and an iron. The room is very small, and although clean, everything is a bit old - especially the cracked tiles in the bathroom, the frayed towels and the threadbare sheets. Even the aircon sounded like it was on its last legs. The free potato crackers were a welcome inclusion, however. It is in a dodgy rent-by-the-hour neighbourhood, but not too far from the MRT station. Have a look around and see if you can find something better, but if not, this at least is fairly decent and relatively secure.

Reviews.Title: “One of the wrost hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: VikiHungary
Reviews.Content: Mini room,terrible bathroom,terrible location,and the staff!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it's claimed..”
Reviews.Author: Moundev
Reviews.Content: Ok, I can see all the other reviews pan the place; I personally had no problems: room was small and spare but clean: if all you're going to be doing is sleeping there what more do you need? While the bathroom does get wet I've found that to be a feature of most Asian hotels.. hence the drain in the floor! Its convenient for Kallang MRT (And therefore Changi), the staff are pleasant and friendly if slightly bumbling (in a charming way!) Sure, its in the Red Light district, and yes, the girls are all over the place, but I had no disturbance at night (I was there five days) and the Geylang area at night is earthy and vibrant rather than seedy, with some excellent hawker centres. Wouldn't recommend it for folks with children but for anyone looking for a decent budget sleep and an open mind its great. I'd happily go back. (One word of caution: if you know peole in Singapore they'll be horrified to hear you're staying there and won't come near the place if they can avoid it!)

Reviews.Title: “Warning!”
Reviews.Author: onthroadagain-7
Reviews.Content: Booked through AOL travel, I thought it was a bargain at 30$US I arrived at 9 a.m. and was charged 30SGD for early check in, room was small but clean, welcome after an all night flight. When I returned at 10 p.m. the street was filled with woman wishing to spend time with me, seriously hundreds of woman of the night in the area. All night doors slaming, loud talk in the hallway. I left at 3 a.m. IT WAS NOT THE BARGAIN I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst MOTELS I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: mzkaren
Reviews.Content: The hotel puts a good front. I mean the lobby is pretty nice and the hallway to the room is decent. This may be the only positive comments you will eve hear about this hotel. The room is extremely small. I had to open my luggage on the bed and side step around the whole room. The floors were extremely dirty and the room had this certain scent. It was disgusting to keep waking up to that scent through the night. I had to sleep with the bed sheet over my face since the scent was overpowering. The sink also smelled terrible. It was definately coming from the drain. When I took a shower, everything in the bathroom was drenched since there is nothing partitioning any part of the bathroom. Just imagine a square - top left: shower, bottom left: toilet, top right:sink, bottom right:door, center, drain. This bathroom was probably no bigger than 5' x 4' (please keep in mind that I'm being extremely generous with this size). If you don't believe me... check out my pictures!! When we came back into our room that night, the power in the room was off. We called the maid who was cleaning a couple of doors down. She came in with folded up jeans, tshirt and no shoes. The most disgusting thing in this room would have to be the little chair for the mirror. You couldn't even sit on the chair because of the diseases it may have contained. There countless dripstains all over the chair. Worst of all, the minute you step outside of the hotel, there are six or seven prostitutes standing five inches apart. I gave them the benefit of the doubt, but when I came back about nine hours later, they were still there. Some were being dropped off by other men. You make the call. Thank god, we only stayed for one night. We did have this reserved about a week later for two nights, but I'm sure it was worth the $25 to change the reservation. Bottom line, if you are broke and want to stay in a roach motel to see beautiful Singapore, please stay here. Otherwise, Singapore hotels may just be a spare no expense issue to ensure a decent stay. I suggest the M hotel! This should be their ad: If you want to take a shower, do some business in the toilet, brush your teeth and watch T.V at the same time, this is the place for you!!! Please do not take this review lightly, for we do not intend to exaggerate, but speak of nothing but the truth. If you don't believe me, please check it out for yourself. You will be back here opening up an account just to warn other travelers to stay away from this.

HotelInfo.Name: Fragrance Hotel - Emerald
HotelInfo.Address: 20 Lorong 6 Geylang, Singapore 399174, Singapore
